speaker: Clockwork Hall
lines: Gears taller than houses nest in walls like patient animals.
A pendulum sweeps a room clear of everything but time.
Cogs click lullabies; axles hum hymns.
Oil smells like yesterday being kind to today.
A control dais waits for hands that remember a sequence no one taught you.
A bronze door at the far end pretends it is asleep.
The hum sharpens; the floor trembles; bolts consider protests and withdraw them.
Something enormous uncurls from stillness and learns it again as it rises.
The hall claps its teeth shut to keep the noise in.

choices.text: Throw the lever the way the pendulum suggests.
